subSubSection.paragraph: Occurs as terrestrial in montane rain forests.

This species resembles Thelypteris (Steiropteris) decussata (L.) Proctor, but differs from it by the costae abaxially with dense, soft, septate hairs 1-2 mm long, costules and veins adaxially with dense, strigose hairs up to 2 mm ( Tryon et al. 1992 ).
